intro: Consolida deserti-syriaci, commonly known as the Syrian Consolida, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Papaveraceae. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of the Middle East and Central Asia. The plant features delicate, spurred petals and produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. It typically grows from seeds and thrives in well-drained soils. Its botanical characteristics make it an interesting subject for study in ecological and horticultural contexts.
